nodes.description: Students continue to develop the skills acquired in Hebrew 2 with emphasis on speaking and on understanding the spoken language. Readings this term include short stories and articles.

This course is for advanced level students and uses Hebrew language literature, print and electronic media, film, and TV shows. Emphasis is placed on conversation, modern Hebrew literature, and composition.

This course introduces students to the fundamentals of the Hebrew language. We study basic vocabulary, grammar and sentence structure, and learn to read and write Hebrew. Emphasis is learning to speak the language.

This course will survey different aspects of Israeli culture and society as reflected in Israeli cinema and television since the establishment of the state in 1948. No previous knowledge of Hebrew or Israel required. All readings will be in English and we will watch films and TV with English subtitles. Students with proficient Hebrew may enroll in HEBREW 1906 for a 1 credit add-on to work with Hebrew sources.
